title: California Oil Spill May Have Been Caused by Anchor Hitting Pipeline
sub_head: Federal and state officials have launched a criminal investigation into the 126,000 gallon spill off the coast of Orange County
body:
The oil spill off the coast of Southern California may have been caused by a boat anchor hitting an underwater pipeline and causing it to rupture, the chief executive of the energy company whose equipment was involved said Monday.
Amplify Energy Corp. chief executive Martyn Willsher said at a press conference that his company has surveyed more than 8,000 feet of pipe located about 4.5 miles off the coast using remote-controlled underwater cameras and has concluded that an anchor collision is a “distinct possibility.”
